title: Ticket #3750: Improve DAGMan metrics reporting
description:
As per discussion with Miron, Ewa, and Karan today:

  • All information needed for reporting should be specified in the DAG file itself, not by environment variables/configuration. (Hmm -- I wonder if a per-DAG config file is okay?)
  • Instead of reporting "simple" and sub-DAG job totals, report by node category -- then the nodes can be split up however people want. (Pegasus would specify appropriate categories in the DAG file.)
  • Have the Pegasus people provide the program/script that actually reports the metrics to their server.
  • Possibly pass info to the reporter program as a classad.
remarks:
2013-Jul-15 16:28:07 by wenger:
We should have totals for nodes that don't have a category, as well as for each category.

Also, I'm a little concerned about this interfering with the use of categories for throttling. Maybe we should have separate categories for metrics reporting?

2013-Jul-31 17:52:35 by wenger:
Hmm -- something else just occurred to me: in the current metrics reporting, we have the schedd machine's IP address as part of the dagman_id value. I wonder if we can really consider this "anonymous" with that information included...
